intro: Gomidesia minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered gomidesia, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, small flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is native to parts of South America. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
